page.title: 08SHOPS AND TRADE IN TYNEMOUTH
page.content: The shops in Tynemouth are mostly fairly small, often family-run shops catering for the local population. There are a number of shops catering for the everyday needs of the residents but there are no department stores. For this kind of shops, the new integrated transport system comprising the Metro rapid transport tramway and bus services put the city of Newcastle upon Tyne within easy reach. A growing number of shops cater for visitors and tourists - antiques, paintings and crafts - and some of these have been built in a converted church to make an attractive shopping mall - The Land of Green Ginger. There also a number of restaurants and take-away hot food shops.
